explanation: The report is correct. When HAVE_MESSAGES is not defined the if-body reduces to a single statement (void)0; — an executed no-op expression-statement. Removing that statement does not change program behaviour (no side-effects, no observable timing or state change required by the code), so it is an operation that is executed but redundant and therefore constitutes dead code under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. (The original presence of the cast-to-void is likely intended to suppress compiler warnings about an empty block, but that does not prevent it from being dead code per Rule 2.2.)
